Race.SpecificTitle: PW School Board -- 7.15 Mill - SB - 10 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide School Board Proposition
(Millage Continuation)

Summary:  10-year 7.15-mill property tax continuation for giving additional aid and support to the public schools in Grant Parish.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish School Board of the Parish of Grant, State of Louisiana, continue to levy and collect a special tax of seven and fifteen hundredths (7.15) mills on all property subject to taxation in said Parish (an estimated $244,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of giving additional aid and support to the public schools in Grant Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: Georgetwn. Sch. #16 (#1) -- Prop.#1 - 4.31 Mill - SB - 10 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 1
(Millage Continuation)

Summary:  10-year 4.31-mill property tax continuation for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating public school buildings and other school-related facilities in Georgetown School District No. 16.
Race.FullText: Shall Georgetown School District No. 16 of the Parish of Grant, Louisiana, continue to levy and collect a special tax of four and thirty-one hundredths (4.31) mills on all property subject to taxation in said School District (an estimated $9,300 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating public school buildings and other school-related facilities in said School District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Georgetwn. Sch. #16 (#2) -- Prop.#2 - 16.12 Mill - SB - 10 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 2
 (Millage Continuation)

Summary: 10-year 16.12-mill property tax continuation for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating public school buildings and other school-related
facilities in Georgetown School District No. 16.
Race.FullText: Shall Georgetown School District No. 16 of the Parish of Grant, Louisiana, continue to levy and collect a special tax of sixteen and twelve hundredths (16.12) mills on all property subject to taxation in said School District (an estimated $34,900 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating public school buildings and other school-related facilities in said School District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Montgomery School Dist#21 -- 4.38 Mill - SB - 10 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
Montgomery School District No. 21 Proposition
(Millage Renewal)

Summary:  10-year 4.38-mill property tax renewal for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating public school buildings and other school-related facilities in Montgomery School District No. 21.
Race.FullText: Shall Montgomery School District No. 21 of the Parish of Grant, Louisiana, continue to levy and collect a special tax of four and thirty-eight hundredths (4.38) mills on all property subject to taxation in said School District (an estimated $10,300 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating public school buildings and other school-related facilities in said School District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Cons. School Dist.No.33-1 -- Prop.#1 - 2.66 Mill - SB - 10 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 1
(Millage Continuation)

Summary:  10-year 2.66-mill property tax continuation for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating public school buildings and other school-related
facilities in Consolidated School District No. 33.
Race.FullText: Shall Consolidated School District No. 33 of Grant Parish, Louisiana, continue to levy and collect a two and sixty-six hundredths (2.66) mills on all property subject to taxation in said School District (an estimated $74,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating public school buildings and other school-related facilities in said School District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Cons. School Dist.No.33-2 -- Prop.#2 - $14,000,000 Bond - SB - 20 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 2
 (Bond)

Summary:  Authority to issue 20-year bonds to the amount of $14,000,000 for the purpose of acquiring and/or improving lands for building sites and playgrounds, including construction of necessary sidewalks and streets adjacent thereto; purchasing,
erecting and/or improving school buildings and other school related facilities within and for the District and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, title to which shall be in the public.
Race.FullText: Shall Consolidated School District No. 33 of Grant Parish, Louisiana (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of Fourteen Million Dollars ($14,000,000), to run twenty (20) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate not exceeding nine per centum (9%) per annum, to be sold at par, premium or discount, for the purpose of acquiring and/or improving lands for building sites and playgrounds, including construction of necessary sidewalks and streets adjacent thereto; purchasing, erecting and/or improving school buildings and other school related facilities within and for the District and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, title to which shall be in the public; which bonds will be general obligations of the District and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974 and statutory authority supplemental thereto?
